unit: Unit 8 | Inference for Categorical Data: Chi-Square
title: Conditions for Chi-Squared GOF
question_text:
Conditions necessary for a chi-squared goodness of fit include which of the following?
I. Two independent SRSs. II. Expected counts must all be greater than $5$. III. np and n(1-p) must both be at least $10$
solution:
Statement I is incorrect; a chi-squared test is usually performed on a single sample, or can be performed on multiple samples or an experiment where subjects are randomly assigned into different groups. However, the sample does not HAVE to be 2 independent random samples

Statement II is correct. This is a condition necessary for Chi Squared. Some textbooks add that all expected counts must be over 1, and no more than 20% of expected counts can be less than 5. However, the general consensus is that all expected counts must be at least 5.

Statement III is incorrect. That is correct for 1 proportion Z procedures, but not Chi Squared.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'A'.
